metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: HTML Versus XHTML
XHTML is a stricter, more XML-based version of HTML.
content.html: XHTML is a stricter, more XML-based version of HTML.

content.text: What is XHTML?
Why XHTML?
XML is a markup language where all documents must be marked up correctly (be "well-formed").
content.html: XML is a markup language where all documents must be marked up correctly (be "well-formed").

content.text: XHTML was developed to make HTML more extensible and flexible to work with other data formats (such as XML). In addition, browsers ignore errors in HTML pages, and try to display the website even if it has some errors in the markup. So XHTML comes with a much stricter error handling.
content.html: XHTML was developed to make HTML more extensible and flexible to work with other data formats (such as XML). In addition, browsers ignore errors in HTML pages, and try to display the website even if it has some errors in the markup. So XHTML comes with a much stricter error handling.

content.text: If you want to study XML, please read our XML Tutorial .
content.html: If you want to study XML, please read our XML Tutorial.

content.text: The Most Important Differences from HTML
XHTML - <!DOCTYPE ....> Is Mandatory
An XHTML document must have an XHTML <!DOCTYPE> declaration.
content.html: An XHTML document must have an XHTML <!DOCTYPE> declaration.

content.text: The <html>, <head>, <title>, and <body> elements must also be present, and the xmlns attribute in <html> must specify the xml namespace for the document.
content.html: The <html>, <head>, <title>, and <body> elements must also be present, and the xmlns attribute in <html> must specify the xml namespace for the document.

content.code:
<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.1//EN"
"http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml11/DTD/xhtml11.dtd">
<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">

<head>


<title>Title of document</title>

</head>

<body>

   


</body>

</html>
content.code_html:
<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.1//EN"
"http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml11/DTD/xhtml11.dtd">
<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">
<head>
  <title>Title of document</title>
</head>
<body>

  some content here...

</body>
</html>

content.text: XHTML Elements Must be Properly Nested
In XHTML, elements must always be properly nested within each other, like this:
content.html: In XHTML, elements must always be properly nested within each other, like this:

content.code_html: <b><i>Some text</i></b>
<b><i>Some text</b></i>

content.text: XHTML Elements Must Always be Closed
In XHTML, elements must always be closed, like this:
content.html: In XHTML, elements must always be closed, like this:

content.code:
This is a paragraph

This is another paragraph
content.code_html:
<p>This is a paragraph</p>
<p>This is another paragraph</p>

content.code:
This is a paragraph

This is another paragraph
content.code_html:
<p>This is a paragraph
<p>This is another paragraph

content.text: XHTML Empty Elements Must Always be Closed
In XHTML, empty elements must always be closed, like this:
content.html: In XHTML, empty elements must always be closed, like this:

content.code:
A break:
A horizontal rule:
An image:
content.code_html:
A break: <br />
A horizontal rule: <hr />
An image: <img src="happy.gif" alt="Happy face" />

content.code:
A break:
A horizontal rule:
An image:
content.code_html:
A break: <br>
A horizontal rule: <hr>
An image: <img src="happy.gif" alt="Happy face">

content.text: XHTML Elements Must be in Lowercase
In XHTML, element names must always be in lowercase, like this:
content.html: In XHTML, element names must always be in lowercase, like this:

content.code_html:
<body>
<p>This is a paragraph</p>
</body>

<BODY>
<P>This is a paragraph</P>
</BODY>

content.text: XHTML Attribute Names Must be in Lowercase
In XHTML, attribute names must always be in lowercase, like this:
content.html: In XHTML, attribute names must always be in lowercase, like this:

content.code_html: <a href="https://www.w3schools.com/html/">Visit our HTML tutorial</a>
<a HREF="https://www.w3schools.com/html/">Visit our HTML tutorial</a>

content.text: XHTML Attribute Values Must be Quoted
In XHTML, attribute values must always be quoted, like this:
content.html: In XHTML, attribute values must always be quoted, like this:

content.code_html: <a href="https://www.w3schools.com/html/">Visit our HTML tutorial</a>
<a href=https://www.w3schools.com/html/>Visit our HTML tutorial</a>

content.text: XHTML Attribute Minimization is Forbidden
In XHTML, attribute minimization is forbidden:

content.code:
<input type="checkbox" name="vehicle" value="car" checked="checked" />
<input type="text" name="lastname" disabled="disabled" />
content.code_html:
<input type="checkbox" name="vehicle" value="car" checked="checked" />
<input type="text" name="lastname" disabled="disabled" />

content.code:
<input type="checkbox" name="vehicle" value="car" checked />
<input type="text" name="lastname" disabled />
content.code_html:
<input type="checkbox" name="vehicle" value="car" checked />
<input type="text" name="lastname" disabled />
